x_symbol.description: Animate an element along an elliptical path.
x_symbol.syntax: xEllipse(ele, xRadius, yRadius, radiusInc, totalTime, startAngle, stopAngle)

par.name: xRadius
par.note: unsigned integer. The horizontal radius of the ellipse. Must be > 0

par.name: yRadius
par.note: unsigned integer. The vertical radius of the ellipse. Must be > 0

par.name: radiusInc
par.note: integer. The integer change in radius per iteration. Can be negative. Provides for some interesting effects.

par.name: totalTime
par.note: unsigned integer. The total duration of the animation in milliseconds. Must be > 0

par.name: startAngle
par.note: integer. The start angle in degrees.

par.name: stopAngle
par.note: integer. The stop angle in degrees. If (stopAngle - startAngle) is positive then the animation will be clockwise. if it is negative then the animation will be counter-clockwise. (stopAngle - startAngle) must be non-zero.

prop.name: stop
prop.note: read/write - the stop property on the element itself, when true, will stop animation

prop.name: moving
prop.note: read-only - the moving property on the element itself, when true, indicates animation is active

prop.name: timeout
prop.note: read/write - the timeout property on the element itself, determines frequency of iterations, default is 25

prop.name: onslideend
prop.note: read/write - the onslideend property on the element itself, if defined, will be called at the end of the slide. It does not get called if ele.stop becomes true. It is not reset - the listener can set this.onslideend=null for a 'one-shot'. In the slideEnd listener 'this' points to ele, and you have access to the properties listed here.
